cards.name: Alaborn Cavalier
cards.text: Whenever Alaborn Cavalier attacks, you may tap target creature.
cards.originalText: Whenever Alaborn Cavalier attacks, you may tap target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Course he ran! I wouldn't want to stare down that barrel, either!"
—Alaborn soldier

cards.name: Armillary Sphere
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Armillary Sphere: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Armillary Sphere: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The mysterious purpose of two of the rings had eluded Esper mages—until now.

cards.name: Benalish Lancer
cards.text:
Kicker {2}{W} (You may pay an additional {2}{W} as you cast this spell.)
If Benalish Lancer was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with first strike.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {2}{W} (You may pay an additional {2}{W} as you cast this spell.)
If Benalish Lancer was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with first strike.

cards.name: Bloodmark Mentor
cards.text: Red creatures you control have first strike.
cards.originalText: Red creatures you control have first strike.
cards.flavor: Boggarts divide the world into two categories: things you can eat, and things you have to chase down and pummel before you can eat.

cards.name: Bogardan Hellkite
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
When Bogardan Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
cards.originalText:
Flash
Flying
When Bogardan Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

rulings.text: The number of targets chosen for the enters-the-battlefield ability must be at least 1 and at most 5. You divide the damage as you put the ability on the stack, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

foreignNames.name: ボガーダンのヘルカイト

cards.name: Bogardan Rager
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Bogardan Rager enters the battlefield, target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Bogardan Rager enters the battlefield, target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In the erupting heart of Bogardan, it's hard to tell hurtling volcanic rocks from pouncing volcanic beasts.

cards.name: Breath of Darigaaz
cards.text:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Breath of Darigaaz deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player. If Breath of Darigaaz was kicked, it deals 4 damage to each creature without flying and each player instead.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Breath of Darigaaz deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player. If Breath of Darigaaz was kicked, it deals 4 damage to each creature without flying and each player instead.

cards.name: Captive Flame
cards.text: {R}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {R}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Kills and cooks your food in one easy stroke."

cards.name: Caravan Escort
cards.text:
Level up {2} ({2}: Put a level counter on this. Level up only as a sorcery.)
LEVEL 1-4
2/2
LEVEL 5+
5/5
First strike
cards.originalText:
Level up {2} ({2}: Put a level counter on this. Level up only as a sorcery.)
LEVEL 1-4
2/2
LEVEL 5+
5/5
First strike

rulings.text: The abilities a leveler grants to itself don't overwrite any other abilities it may have. In particular, they don't overwrite the creature's level up ability; it always has that.

Effects that set a leveler's power or toughness to a specific value, including the effects from a level symbol's ability, apply in timestamp order. The timestamp of each level symbol's ability is the same as the timestamp of the leveler itself, regardless of when the most recent level counter was put on it.

Effects that modify a leveler's power or toughness, such as the effects of Giant Growth or Glorious Anthem, will apply to it no matter when they started to take effect. The same is true for counters that change the creature's power or toughness (such as +1/+1 counters) and effects that switch its power and toughness.

If another creature becomes a copy of a leveler, all of the leveler's printed abilities -- including those represented by level symbols -- are copied. The current characteristics of the leveler, and the number of level counters on it, are not. The abilities, power, and toughness of the copy will be determined based on how many level counters are on the copy.

A creature's level is based on how many level counters it has on it, not how many times its level up ability has been activated or has resolved. If a leveler gets level counters due to some other effect (such as Clockspinning) or loses level counters for some reason (such as Vampire Hexmage), its level is changed accordingly.

cards.name: Cinder Wall
cards.text:
Defender
When Cinder Wall blocks, destroy it at end of combat.
cards.originalText:
Defender
When Cinder Wall blocks, destroy it at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"The smell of roasted flesh hung over the valley for hours."
—Onean sergeant

cards.name: Claws of Valakut
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each Mountain you control and has first strike.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each Mountain you control and has first strike.
cards.flavor: "Swords may sunder. Shields may fail. My will is stronger than steel, and my flesh and bone far more deadly."

foreignNames.name: ヴァラクートのかぎ爪

cards.name: Cone of Flame
cards.text: Cone of Flame deals 1 damage to target creature or player, 2 damage to another target creature or player, and 3 damage to a third target creature or player.
cards.originalText: Cone of Flame deals 1 damage to target creature or player, 2 damage to another target creature or player, and 3 damage to a third target creature or player.

rulings.text: Each of the three targets must be different. If there aren’t three different legal targets available, you can't cast the spell.
If one or two of Cone of Flame’s targets are illegal when it resolves, you can’t change how much damage will be dealt to the remaining legal targets.

cards.name: Dragon Fodder
cards.text: Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Goblins journey to the sacrificial peaks in pairs so that the rare survivor might be able to relate the details of the other's grisly demise.

cards.name: Dragon Whelp
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: The first three times Dragon Whelp's ability is activated in a turn will do nothing other than give it +1/+0 until end of turn. Any subsequent activations will also cause its delayed triggered ability to trigger. That means if you activate Dragon Whelp's ability five times, for example, two different delayed triggered abilities will trigger at the beginning of the next end step and cause you to sacrifice Dragon Whelp.

If the fourth (or more) time Dragon Whelp's ability is activated during the same turn happens to be during that turn's end step, the delayed triggered ability won't trigger until the beginning of the next turn's end step. You'll have to sacrifice Dragon Whelp at that time.

cards.name: Dragon's Claw
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a red spell.
If a player casts a red spell, Dragon's Claw's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Dragon's Claw's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

cards.name: Dragonspeaker Shaman
cards.text: Dragon spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
cards.originalText: Dragon spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
cards.flavor: "We speak the dragons' language of flame and rage. They speak our language of fury and honor. Together we shall weave a tale of destruction without equal."

cards.name: Edge of Autumn
cards.text:
If you control four or fewer lands, search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
Cycling—Sacrifice a land. (Sacrifice a land, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.originalText:
If you control four or fewer lands, search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
Cycling—Sacrifice a land. (Sacrifice a land, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: "At harvest are seeds of next year sown."

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.name: Fiery Fall
cards.text:
Fiery Fall deals 5 damage to target creature.
Basic landcycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
cards.originalText:
Fiery Fall deals 5 damage to target creature.
Basic landcycling {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
cards.flavor: Jund feasts on the unprepared.

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, basic landcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a basic land card. You don't choose the type of basic land card you'll find until you're performing the search. After you choose a basic land card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Basic landcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on a card being basic landcycled. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops a basic landcycling ability from being activated.

Basic landcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with basic landcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose not to find a basic land card, even if there is one in your library.

cards.name: Fire-Belly Changeling
cards.text:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{R}: Fire-Belly Changeling gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
cards.originalText:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{R}: Fire-Belly Changeling gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
cards.flavor:
"My ears say it hisses. My fingers say it burns."
—Auntie Wort

cards.name: Ghostfire
cards.text:
Ghostfire is colorless.
Ghostfire deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText:
Ghostfire is colorless.
Ghostfire deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Only those gifted with the eye of Ugin, the spirit dragon, can see his fiery breath.

rulings.text: Ghostfire is colorless in all zones. Its damage comes from a colorless source.

cards.name: Grasslands
cards.text:
Grasslands enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Grasslands: Search your library for a Forest or Plains card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText:
Grasslands enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Grasslands: Search your library for a Forest or Plains card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You do not have to find a plains or forest card if you do not want to.

cards.name: Griffin Guide
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
When enchanted creature dies, put a 2/2 white Griffin creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, put a 2/2 white Griffin creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: If Griffin Guide and the enchanted creature go to the graveyard at the same time, Griffin Guide's ability will trigger.

printings: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

cards.name: Harm's Way
cards.text: The next 2 damage that a source of your choice would deal to you and/or permanents you control this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.
cards.originalText: The next 2 damage that a source of your choice would deal to you and/or permanents you control this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.
cards.flavor: Even when fate is already written, there's always time to change the names.

rulings.text: As you cast Harm's Way, you target the creature or player that the redirected damage will be dealt to. As Harm's Way resolves, you choose a source of damage. You never choose the original recipient of the damage; Harm's Way will apply to whatever the chosen source tries to deal damage to, as long as it's you or a permanent you control.
Harm's Way can affect damage that would be dealt to a planeswalker you control (as well as damage that would be dealt to you, or to a creature you control).

If the chosen source would deal just 1 damage to you or a permanent you control, Harm's Way's effect will redirect that damage and still have a "shield" left for another 1 damage from that source later in the turn.

If the chosen source would simultaneously deal damage to multiple permanents you control (like Pyroclasm could) or to you and at least one permanent you control (like Earthquake could), Harm's Way will redirect just 2 of that damage. It won't redirect the next 2 damage that would be dealt to each recipient. You choose which 2 damage is redirected. If you like, you can choose to redirect 1 damage that would be dealt by the chosen source to each of two different recipients.

After Harm's Way resolves, it no longer checks to see if the targeted creature or player is a legal target. However, if that creature or player can't be dealt damage at the time the chosen source would deal damage (perhaps because the creature is no longer on the battlefield or is no longer a creature, or because the player is no longer in the game), the damage can't be redirected. It's dealt to the original recipient.
Harm's Way has no effect on damage that's already been dealt.

cards.name: Henge Guardian
cards.text: {2}: Henge Guardian gains trample until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {2}: Henge Guardian gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Like so many Thran relics, the wurm engine kept operating long after its creators were gone.

cards.name: Heroes' Reunion
cards.text: Target player gains 7 life.
cards.originalText: Target player gains 7 life.
cards.flavor:
"You helped save my people from a Phyrexian fate. Did you think I wouldn't return the favor?"
—Eladamri, to Gerrard

cards.name: Jaws of Stone
cards.text: Jaws of Stone deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players, where X is the number of Mountains you control as you cast Jaws of Stone.
cards.originalText: Jaws of Stone deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players, where X is the number of Mountains you control as you cast Jaws of Stone.
cards.flavor: When giants find their mountain homes infested, they have a whole range of solutions.

rulings.text: The amount of damage is locked in as you cast Jaws of Stone. It won't change, even if the number of Mountains you control changes.
If you control no Mountains as you cast Jaws of Stone, the number of targets must be zero.

If you control any Mountains as you cast Jaws of Stone, the number of targets must be at least one and at most X. You divide the damage among the targets as you cast Jaws of Stone. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

cards.name: Juniper Order Ranger
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature and a +1/+1 counter on Juniper Order Ranger.
cards.originalText: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature and a +1/+1 counter on Juniper Order Ranger.
cards.flavor: To protect the alliance between Kjeldor and Yavimaya, they trained in the ways of both.

rulings.text: The creature doesn't enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It enters the battlefield, then the ability triggers. If either that creature or Juniper Order Ranger leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the remaining creature will still get a +1/+1 counter.

foreignNames.name: 杜松騎士団のレインジャー
Guardabosque de la Orden del Enebro

cards.text:

rulings.text: The abilities a leveler grants to itself don't overwrite any other abilities it may have. In particular, they don't overwrite the creature's level up ability; it always has that.

Effects that set a leveler's power or toughness to a specific value, including the effects from a level symbol's ability, apply in timestamp order. The timestamp of each level symbol's ability is the same as the timestamp of the leveler itself, regardless of when the most recent level counter was put on it.

Effects that modify a leveler's power or toughness, such as the effects of Giant Growth or Glorious Anthem, will apply to it no matter when they started to take effect. The same is true for counters that change the creature's power or toughness (such as +1/+1 counters) and effects that switch its power and toughness.

If another creature becomes a copy of a leveler, all of the leveler's printed abilities -- including those represented by level symbols -- are copied. The current characteristics of the leveler, and the number of level counters on it, are not. The abilities, power, and toughness of the copy will be determined based on how many level counters are on the copy.

A creature's level is based on how many level counters it has on it, not how many times its level up ability has been activated or has resolved. If a leveler gets level counters due to some other effect (such as Clockspinning) or loses level counters for some reason (such as Vampire Hexmage), its level is changed accordingly.

cards.name: Kilnmouth Dragon
cards.text:
Amplify 3 (As this creature enters the battlefield, put three +1/+1 counters on it for each Dragon card you reveal in your hand.)
Flying
{T}: Kilnmouth Dragon deals damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to target creature or player.
cards.originalText:
Amplify 3 (As this creature enters the battlefield, put three +1/+1 counters on it for each Dragon card you reveal in your hand.)
Flying
{T}: Kilnmouth Dragon deals damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to target creature or player.

cards.name: Kinsbaile Cavalier
cards.text: Knight creatures you control have double strike.
cards.originalText: Knight creatures you control have double strike.
cards.flavor: Ambidexterity is common among kithkin. The thoughtweft links the minds of the left- and right-handed, giving each the knack of the other.

cards.name: Knight Exemplar
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Other Knight creatures you control get +1/+1 and have indestructible. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)
cards.originalText:
First strike
Other Knight creatures you control get +1/+1 and are indestructible.
cards.flavor: "If you think you are brave enough to walk the path of honor, follow me into the dragon's den."

rulings.text: If an effect would simultaneously destroy Knight Exemplar and another Knight creature you control, only Knight Exemplar is destroyed.

Lethal damage, damage from a source with deathtouch, and effects that say "destroy" won't cause a creature with indestructible to be put into the graveyard. However, a creature with indestructible can be put into the graveyard for a number of reasons. The most likely reasons are if it's sacrificed, if it's legendary and another legendary creature with the same name is controlled by the same player, or if its toughness is 0 or less.

If another Knight creature you control is dealt lethal damage, the creature isn't destroyed, but the damage remains marked on it. If, at some point later in that turn, you no longer control Knight Exemplar or it loses its abilities, the other Knight creature will lose indestructible and will be destroyed.
If you control two Knight Exemplars, each one causes the other to get +1/+1 and have indestructible.

cards.text:
Level up {3} ({3}: Put a level counter on this. Level up only as a sorcery.)
LEVEL 1-3
2/3
Flying

4/4
Flying, vigilance

rulings.text: The abilities a leveler grants to itself don't overwrite any other abilities it may have. In particular, they don't overwrite the creature's level up ability; it always has that.

Effects that set a leveler's power or toughness to a specific value, including the effects from a level symbol's ability, apply in timestamp order. The timestamp of each level symbol's ability is the same as the timestamp of the leveler itself, regardless of when the most recent level counter was put on it.

Effects that modify a leveler's power or toughness, such as the effects of Giant Growth or Glorious Anthem, will apply to it no matter when they started to take effect. The same is true for counters that change the creature's power or toughness (such as +1/+1 counters) and effects that switch its power and toughness.

If another creature becomes a copy of a leveler, all of the leveler's printed abilities -- including those represented by level symbols -- are copied. The current characteristics of the leveler, and the number of level counters on it, are not. The abilities, power, and toughness of the copy will be determined based on how many level counters are on the copy.

A creature's level is based on how many level counters it has on it, not how many times its level up ability has been activated or has resolved. If a leveler gets level counters due to some other effect (such as Clockspinning) or loses level counters for some reason (such as Vampire Hexmage), its level is changed accordingly.

cards.name: Knight of Meadowgrain
cards.text:
First strike
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.originalText: First strike, lifelink
cards.flavor: "By tradition, we don't speak for two days after battle. If our deeds won't speak for themselves, what else could be said?"

foreignNames.name: メドウグレインの騎士

cards.name: Knight of the Reliquary
cards.text:
Knight of the Reliquary gets +1/+1 for each land card in your graveyard.
{T}, Sacrifice a Forest or Plains: Search your library for a land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText:
Knight of the Reliquary gets +1/+1 for each land card in your graveyard.
{T}, Sacrifice a Forest or Plains: Search your library for a land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: The activated ability's cost checks the land's subtype, not its name. You can sacrifice a nonbasic land this way as long as it has the subtype Forest or Plains.

Sacrificing a Forest or Plains is part of the cost of Knight of the Reliquary's activated ability. Assuming that sacrificing the land puts it into your graveyard, Knight of the Reliquary's first ability will immediately give it an additional +1/+1 when that cost is paid because there'll be a new land card in your graveyard. Paying a cost can't be responded to (with Shock, for example).
Knight of the Reliquary's activated ability lets you find any land card, not just a basic land card.

cards.name: Knight of the White Orchid
cards.text:
First strike
When Knight of the White Orchid enters the battlefield, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for a Plains card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText:
First strike
When Knight of the White Orchid enters the battlefield, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for a Plains card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Both guide and guard on open plain.

rulings.text: Knight of the White Orchid's triggered ability has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless any one of your opponents controls more lands than you, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you control at least as many lands as each of your opponents by the time it resolves.

cards.name: Knotvine Paladin
cards.text: Whenever Knotvine Paladin attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each untapped creature you control.
cards.originalText: Whenever Knotvine Paladin attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each untapped creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"He is part of a new breed of guardian, one who embraces the best of both his world and ours."
—Mayael the Anima

rulings.text: The number of untapped creatures you control is counted as the ability resolves, and the bonus is locked in at that time. By this point, other attacking creatures will already be tapped (unless they have vigilance).

cards.name: Leonin Skyhunter
cards.text: Flying
cards.originalText: Flying
cards.flavor: The skyhunters were born when the first leonin gazed at the heavens and wished to hunt the birds overhead.

cards.name: Lionheart Maverick
cards.text:
Vigilance
{4}{W}: Lionheart Maverick gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Vigilance
{4}{W}: Lionheart Maverick gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Your signet is no symbol of power. It marks only your need for numbers to aid you. What do you do, guild-rat, now that you face my blade alone?"

cards.name: Loxodon Warhammer
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample and lifelink. (If the creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker. Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample and lifelink.
Equip {3}
cards.flavor:
"Tusks to splinter skulls. Steel to shatter scale."
—Warhammer inscription

cards.name: Mighty Leap
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The southern fortress taken by invaders? Heh, sure . . . when elephants fly."
—Brezard Skeinbow, captain of the guard

rulings.text: You may target any creature with Mighty Leap. It's okay if that creature already has flying.
For flying to work as an evasion ability, Mighty Leap must be cast before the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

cards.name: Mordant Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{R}: Mordant Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Whenever Mordant Dragon deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal that much damage to target creature that player controls.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{R}: Mordant Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Whenever Mordant Dragon deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal that much damage to target creature that player controls.

cards.name: Mudbutton Torchrunner
cards.text: When Mudbutton Torchrunner dies, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: When Mudbutton Torchrunner is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: The oil sloshes against his skull as he nears his destination: the Frogtosser Games and the lighting of the Flaming Boggart.

cards.name: Oblivion Ring
cards.text:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.originalText:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

rulings.text: If Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted nonland permanent forever.

If there are no nonland permanents on the battlefield other than an Oblivion Ring, and the card it exiled was another Oblivion Ring, casting a third Oblivion Ring will result in an involuntary infinite loop that will end the game in a draw (unless someone chooses to break it by putting another nonland permanent onto the battlefield or destroying one of the Oblivion Rings, for example).

If the exiled card is an Aura, that card's owner chooses what it will enchant as it comes back onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way doesn't target anything, but the Aura's enchant ability restricts what it can be attached to. If the Aura can't legally be attached to anything, it remains exiled forever.

Auras attached to the exiled permanent will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to the exiled permanent will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.

cards.name: Paladin of Prahv
cards.text:
Whenever Paladin of Prahv deals damage, you gain that much life.
Forecast — {1}{W}, Reveal Paladin of Prahv from your hand: Whenever target creature deals damage this turn, you gain that much life. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)
cards.originalText:
Whenever Paladin of Prahv deals damage, you gain that much life.
Forecast — {1}{W}, Reveal Paladin of Prahv from your hand: Whenever target creature deals damage this turn, you gain that much life. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

cards.name: Plover Knights
cards.text: Flying, first strike
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike
cards.flavor: The knights are a major attraction at every Lammastide festival. Teams of riders perform daring feats of flight to the delight of all below.

cards.name: Punishing Fire
cards.text:
Punishing Fire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Whenever an opponent gains life, you may pay {R}. If you do, return Punishing Fire from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText:
Punishing Fire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Whenever an opponent gains life, you may pay {R}. If you do, return Punishing Fire from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: Punishing Fire's triggered ability triggers only if it's already in your graveyard at the time an opponent gains life. For example, you can cast it in response to a spell or ability that will cause an opponent to gain life. In that case, Punishing Fire will resolve first, so it will be in the graveyard by the time the opponent gains life. However, if you wait until an opponent actually gains life and then cast Punishing Fire, you won't be able to return it to your hand at that time.
You choose whether to pay {R} as the triggered ability resolves.

If Punishing Fire has left your graveyard by the time its triggered ability resolves, you may still pay {R}, but you won't return it to your hand. This is true even if Punishing Fire has left your graveyard and returned to it by the time its triggered ability resolves.

cards.name: Reciprocate
cards.text: Exile target creature that dealt damage to you this turn.
cards.originalText: Exile target creature that dealt damage to you this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Just as the noble soul calls virtue to itself, the evil soul summons harm."
—Teachings of Eight-and-a-Half-Tails

cards.name: Reprisal
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: "Fear this no more!"

cards.name: Seething Song
cards.text: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: Add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: If your flesh can withstand the flame, the spirit of the dragon will burn within your soul.

cards.name: Seismic Strike
cards.text: Seismic Strike deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.originalText: Seismic Strike deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.flavor:
"Life up here is simple. Adapt to the ways of the mountains and they will reward you. Fight them and they will end you."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer

cards.name: Sejiri Steppe
cards.text:
Sejiri Steppe enters the battlefield tapped.
When Sejiri Steppe enters the battlefield, target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText:
Sejiri Steppe enters the battlefield tapped.
When Sejiri Steppe enters the battlefield, target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Selesnya Sanctuary
cards.text:
Selesnya Sanctuary enters the battlefield tapped.
When Selesnya Sanctuary enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {G}{W} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText:
Selesnya Sanctuary enters the battlefield tapped.
When Selesnya Sanctuary enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {G}{W} to your mana pool.

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

cards.name: Shiv's Embrace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Only Shiv's Embrace's controller (who is not necessarily the enchanted creature's controller) can activate its activated ability.

When Shiv's Embrace's activated ability resolves, the creature Shiv's Embrace is enchanting at that time will get +1/+0 (regardless of what creature Shiv's Embrace was enchanting when the ability was activated). If Shiv's Embrace has left the battlefield by then, the creature it was enchanting at the time it left the battlefield will get +1/+0.

cards.name: Shivan Hellkite
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{R}: Shivan Hellkite deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{R}: Shivan Hellkite deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: A dragon's scale can be carved into a mighty shield, provided you can procure a dragontooth to cut it.

cards.name: Sigil Blessing
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature you control gets +3/+3 and other creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, target creature you control gets +3/+3 and other creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: "For unwavering commitment and unflinching strength, the Order of the White Orchid confers its sigil. Rise, knight-captain, and do your duty."

rulings.text: If the targeted creature becomes an illegal target by the time Sigil Blessing resolves, the entire spell will be countered. Your other creatures won't get +1/+1.

cards.name: Silver Knight
cards.text: First strike, protection from red
cards.originalText: First strike, protection from red
cards.flavor: "Hammer out your doubts as you forge your weapon. To slay a dragon, your resolve must be stronger than your steel."

cards.name: Skirk Prospector
cards.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"I like goblins. They make funny little popping sounds when they die."
—Braids, dementia summoner

cards.name: Skyhunter Patrol
cards.text: Flying, first strike (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach, and it deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike
cards.flavor:
"We leonin have come to rule the plains by taking to the skies."
—Raksha Golden Cub

cards.name: Spidersilk Armor
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+1 and have reach. (They can block creatures with flying.)
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +0/+1 and have reach. (They can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: It hardly weighs anything, but it takes all day to remove.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.originalText: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.flavor:
"Within each of you is the strength of a landslide."
—Kumano, to his pupils

cards.name: Steward of Valeron
cards.text:
Vigilance
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText:
Vigilance
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor: Knight-stewards guard the Sun-Dappled Court, a grove of immense, sculptured olive trees that represent Valeron's twelve noble families.

foreignNames.name: ヴァレロンに仕える者

cards.name: Temporary Insanity
cards.text: Untap target creature with power less than the number of cards in your graveyard and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Untap target creature with power less than the number of cards in your graveyard and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Test of Faith
cards.text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn, and put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
cards.originalText: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn, and put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
cards.flavor: Those who survive the test bear a mark of power anyone can recognize.

rulings.text: The +1/+1 counters are put onto the creature at the same time the damage is prevented. If a 1/1 creature would be dealt 6 damage, 3 damage is prevented and three +1/+1 counters are put on the creature. The creature ends up as a 4/4 creature with 3 damage marked on it.

cards.name: Thunder Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Thunder Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Thunder Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor: Sometimes primitive cultures attributed natural phenomena to monsters. Sometimes they were right.

cards.name: Treetop Village
cards.text:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
cards.originalText:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.name: Voracious Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Devour 1 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Voracious Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature or player equal to twice the number of Goblins it devoured.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Devour 1 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Voracious Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature or player equal to twice the number of Goblins it devoured.

rulings.text: Voracious Dragon can devour any type of creatures, not just Goblins.

"The number of Goblins it devoured" means "The number of Goblins sacrificed as a result of its devour ability as it entered the battlefield." For each creature that Voracious Dragon devoured, this ability checks its creature type as it last existed on the battlefield to see if it was a Goblin at that time.

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
cards.originalText: First strike, protection from black
cards.flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.

cards.name: Wilt-Leaf Cavaliers
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.originalText: Vigilance
cards.flavor: Every elf in Shadowmoor is charged from birth with a terrible duty: to strike back against the ugliness and darkness, even though they are all around and seemingly without end.

cards.name: Zhalfirin Commander
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}{W}: Target Knight creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}{W}: Target Knight creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Command is the act of balancing on a vine and convincing others that it is firm ground."
—Sidar Jabari
